dictionary_learning package¶

Submodules¶

dictionary_learning.advanced_debugging module¶

dictionary_learning.advanced_debugging.log_call(logger, print_args=False)[source]¶

Takes a given logger and uses it to log entering and leaving the decorated callable.

Intended to be used as a decorator that takes a few arguments.

Parameters:logger (Logger) – Used for logging entry, exit and possibly arguments.
Keyword Arguments:
 print_args (bool) – Whether to output the arguments and keyword arguments passed to the function. This should not automatically be true as some arguments may not be printable or may be expensive to print. Thus, it should be up to the developer to use their own disgression. Further, we don’t want to break their existing code.
Returns:log_call_decorator (for wrapping)

dictionary_learning.advanced_iterators module¶

dictionary_learning.advanced_iterators.index_generator(*sizes)[source]¶

Takes an argument list of sizes and iterates through them from 0 up to (but including) each size.

Returns:chain_gen – a generator over every possible coordinated
Return type:generator
dictionary_learning.advanced_iterators.list_indices_to_index_array(list_indices)[source]¶

Converts a list of tuple indices to numpy index array.

Parameters:list_indices (list) – a list of indices corresponding to some array object
Returns:chain_gen – a tuple containing a numpy array in for each index
Return type:tuple
dictionary_learning.advanced_iterators.list_indices_to_numpy_bool_array(list_indices, shape)[source]¶

Much like list_indices_to_index_array except that it constructs a numpy.ndarray with dtype of bool. All indices in list_indices are set to True in the numpy.ndarray. The rest are False by default.

Parameters:
  • list_indices (list) – a list of indices corresponding to some numpy.ndarray object
  • shape (tuple) – a tuple used to set the shape of the numpy.ndarray to return
Returns:

result – a numpy.ndarray with dtype bool (True for indices in list_indices and False otherwise).
Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dictionary_learning.batch_learner module¶

dictionary_learning.batch_learner.batch_generate_save_dictionary(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Uses generate_save_dictionary to process a list of filename (HDF5 files) with the given parameters for trainDL. Results will be saved in each file.

dictionary_learning.batch_learner.generate_dictionary(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generates a dictionary using the data and parameters given for trainDL.

Parameters:
  • new_data (numpy.ndarray) – name of the file to read.
  • parameters (dict) – passed directly to spams.trainDL.

Note

Todo Look into move data normalization into separate method (have method chosen by config file).

Returns:the dictionary found.
Return type:dict
dictionary_learning.batch_learner.generate_save_dictionary(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Uses generate_dictionary to process a given filename (HDF5 files) with the given parameters for trainDL.

dictionary_learning.batch_learner.main(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple main function (like in C). Takes all arguments (as from sys.argv) and returns an exit status.

Parameters:argv (list) – arguments (includes command line call).
Returns:exit code (0 if success)
Return type:int
dictionary_learning.batch_learner.read_parameters(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Reads the contents of a json config file and returns the parameters.

Parameters:config_filename – name of the file to read.
Keyword Arguments:
 print_args (bool) – whether to output arguments and keyword arguments passed to the function.
Returns:parameters read from the file.
Return type:dict

dictionary_learning.neuron_viewer module¶

class dictionary_learning.neuron_viewer.NeuronViewer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: matplotlib.figure.Figure

Provides a way to interact with numpy arrays pulled from neuron images.

Wraps a Matplotlib figure instance.

set_images(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets the images to be viewed.

Parameters:new_neuron_images (numpy.ndarray) – array of images (first index is which image)
time_update(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Method to be called by the TimeNavigator when the time changes. Updates image displayed.

class dictionary_learning.neuron_viewer.TimeNavigator(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

begin_time(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets time to min_time.

disconnect(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Disconnects the given cid from being notified of time updates.

end_time(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets time to max_time.

next_time(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets time to one time_step after.

normalize_val(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Takes the time value and normalizes it to fit within the range. Then, makes sure it is a discrete number of steps from the min_time.

Returns:the normalized value.
Return type:int
on_time_update(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Registers a callback function for notification when the time is updated.

Returns:a callback ID or cid to allow pulling the callback when no longer necessary.
Return type:int
prev_time(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets time to one time_step prior.

time_update(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Takes the time value and normalizes it within the range if it does not fit.
